elevator
Class ElevatorIO

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--java.lang.Thread
        |
        +--elevator.ElevatorIO
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
public class ElevatorIO
extends java.lang.Thread

Provides input and execution of control commands (open/close doors, star/stop moving elevators, set/get values of scales) from standard input, TCP socket connections or/and via Java RMI (from servants), and output of action commands from the floor and inside buttons and current position of elevators to standard output, TCP socket or/and via Java RMI (to listening servants).

Fields inherited from class java.lang.Thread
MAX_PRIORITY, MIN_PRIORITY, NORM_PRIORITY
 
Constructor Summary
ElevatorIO(Elevators elevators)
          Creates an instance of ElevatorIO that opens a TCP socket and waits until a client (a controller) connects if Elevators has started with the "-tcp" option, it creates a GetAllImpl object for controlling Elevators via Java RMI and binds its reference (stub) to the "GetAll" name at the rmiregistry if Elevators has started with the "-rmi" option.

Constructor Detail

ElevatorIO

public ElevatorIO(Elevators elevators)
Creates an instance of ElevatorIO that opens a TCP socket and waits until a client (a controller) connects if Elevators has started with the "-tcp" option, it creates a GetAllImpl object for controlling Elevators via Java RMI and binds its reference (stub) to the "GetAll" name at the rmiregistry if Elevators has started with the "-rmi" option.
Parameters:
elevators - is a reference to the object of the Elevators primary class used to access the state of the Elevator objects (the Model)
Method Detail

connectToClient

public void connectToClient(int inPort,
                            int outPort)
Opens a TCP socket or a couple of sockets (if different ports are specified for input and output) and waits until a client(s) connects.
Parameters:
inPort - the input port number (defaults to 4711)
outPort - the output port number (defaults to 4711)

run

public void run()
Reads and execute control commands from standard or socket (if open) input stream in a separate thread until the thread is closed ot the "quit" ("q") command is read from the stream.
Overrides:
run in class java.lang.Thread

readInput

public void readInput()
Reads elevator commands from the standard or the socket (if open) input stream and executes over and over again until the input stream is closed or the "quit" is read from the stream

motor

public void motor(int number,
                  int val)
Executes a "m" ("motor") control command read from standard or socket input stream: starts the elevator moving upwards or downwards, or stops the motor.
Parameters:
number - the integer number of the motor (elevator) to start moving ot to stop
val - the integer code of a motor command: "1" - start moving upwards, "0" - stop, "-1" - start moving downwards.

scale

public void scale(int number,
                  int val)
Executes a "s" ("scale") control command read from standard or socket input stream: sets a given value to the elevator scale.
Parameters:
number - the integer number of the elevator whose scale to set
val - the integer value to be set to the scale of the given elevator.

door

public void door(int number,
                 int val)
Executes a "d" ("door") control command read from standard or socket input stream: starts/stops openning/closing the door.
Parameters:
number - the number of the elevator whose door to open/close
val - the integer code of a door command: "1" - open, "-1" -close, "0" - stop

motorRMI

public void motorRMI(int number,
                     int val)
              throws IllegalParamException
Executes a "m" ("motor") control command accepted on an remote interface used to control motor(s) such as Motor, Motors, Elevator and Elevators. Called by an RMI servant that implements one of these interface. Starts the elevator moving upwards or downwards, or stops the motor.
Parameters:
number - the integer number of the motor (elevator) to start moving ot to stop
val - the integer code of a motor command: "1" - start moving upwards, "0" - stop, "-1" - start moving downwards.
Throws:
IllegalParamException - if number is not a legal elevator number or/and val is not a legal motor command code

scaleRMI

public void scaleRMI(int number,
                     int val)
              throws IllegalParamException
Executes a "s" ("scale") control command accepted on an remote interface used to control scale(s) such as Scale, Scales, Elevator and Elevators. Called by an RMI servant that implements one of these interface. Sets a given value to the elevator scale.
Parameters:
number - the integer number of the elevator whose scale to set
val - the integer value to be set to the scale of the given elevator.
Throws:
IllegalParamException - if number is not a legal elevator number or/and val is not a legal floor number

doorRMI

public void doorRMI(int number,
                    int val)
             throws IllegalParamException
Executes a "d" ("door") control command accepted on an remote interface used to control door(s) such as Door, Doors, Elevator and Elevators. Called by an RMI servant that implements one of these interface. Starts/stops openning/closing the door.
Parameters:
number - the number of the elevator whose door to open/close
val - the integer code of a door command: "1" - open, "-1" -close, "0" - stop
Throws:
IllegalParamException - if number is not a legal elevator number or/and val is not a legal door command code

whereIs

public double whereIs(int number)
               throws IllegalParamException
Executes a "w" ("where") control command accepted on an remote interface used to control motor(s) such as Motor, Motors, Elevator and Elevators. Called by an RMI servant that implements one of these interface and by PositionListener objects (if any). Returns the current position of the elevator to the calling thread.
Parameters:
number - the number of the elevator whose position to get
Returns:
float position of the elevator in "floor units" (e.g. 2.5 "floor units means that the elevator is exactly in between the 2nd and 3rd floor)
Throws:
IllegalParamException - if number is not a legal elevator number

whereAre

public double[] whereAre()
                  throws IllegalParamException
Executes a sequence of "w" ("where") control commands on all elevators accepted on an remote interface used to control motors such as Motors and Elevators. Called by an RMI servant that implements one of these interface and by PositionListener objects (if any). Returns current positions of all elevators to the calling thread.
Returns:
an array of floatint point values of positions of the elevator in "floor units" (e.g. 2.5 "floor units means that the elevator is exactly in between the 2nd and 3rd floor)

getScalePosition

public int getScalePosition(int number)
                     throws IllegalParamException
Returns a current value of a scale. Called by an RMI servant that implements one of the interfaces used to control scales such as Scale, Scales, Elevator and Elevators. Returns current value of the scale.
Parameters:
number - the integer number of the elevator whose scale value to get
Returns:
integer value of the scale
Throws:
IllegalParamException - if number is not a legal elevator number
